website_summaries.verdict: In addition to sun protection, these shirts are also designed to help keep you dry and odor-free.
pros: Anti-microbial properties help keep the shirt odor-free
Sleeves are long and neck is higher to prevent burns on your chest and arms
cons: Some users say it fits a little smaller than the advertised size

customer_reviews.title: I really like the material of the Vapor but I read the ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the material of the Vapor but I read the reviews for sizing and was thrown off (my mistake). I'm 5'11" and 199 and ordered the Medium at some reviewers comments. As it turns out, the Large would have been a better call.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Not full cut.
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT full cut. The fabric is clingy too. Returned item. For outdoor use prefer loose fitting and for the fabric not to stick to the skin. As a body shirt in the gym it is ok and more like body armour products. Description is not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: The white shirt doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I test all my UPF and SPF product with solar print paper. The white shirt I purchased provided almost zero sun protection. I have tested a lot of different UPF clothing, and the white/light colors almost always fail to protect, while the black/dark blue clothing performs much better and provides decent protection. I was disappointed with this shirt particularly because it carries the Skin Cancer Foundation Seal and I hoped the shirts would have a more universal level of protection. I need long white sleeves for a uniform so I may end up keeping it anyway, but I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend tons of money on a shirt to fish so I figured I would give this a try. I usually wear a small/medium in unisex clothing and I got a small. It fit perfectly (with a little bit of extra room). I went with a mens shirt vs a womans because I wanted to cover my neck and chest. I spent a day on a Florida canal fishing and paddle boarding and I didn't have any issues. I burn very easily and this shirt protected my fair skin.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, does the job with the sun
customer_reviews.text: The medium fits like a "tailored fit" tee on me at 5'7"-165. The sleeves are a little long which is to be expected - I'm 32" in a dress shirt. The length fit below the belt - mid butt/fly, all ok. I took it on a test drive mowing the yards in 82 degrees 80 humidity and it did right by me in keeping the sun off. I would give it 5 stars if it dried out more quickly once coming into the A/C, but it didn't do badly, not nearly as slow as cotton.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Kellner

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The shirt came in a plastic bag thinner than a cheap sandwich bag that hole in it and the shirt got covered in little black stains. It came with other items that were not damagedThe stitching is awful! Cheaply made and it's a $25 shirt! Rip off! returning !
customer_reviews.author: iinkredible

customer_reviews.title: What is wrong with these shirts???
customer_reviews.text: This shirt must react negatively to sunscreen or chlorine. I wore this once to a pool party. After I got out of the pool, all of the seams and the neck turned yellow and the torso had brown and black splotches. It looked filthy and all I did was get in a clean swimming pool. I bought the white one and wore it a different day in a different pool and it did the exact same thing. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: James W Bristow

customer_reviews.title: Bought 13 of these shirts and had them screen printed ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 13 of these shirts and had them screen printed for work. I wear these shirts everyday for two months now and I only have a couple left. After washing and drying these shirts the first time. One shirt shrank so badly, the bottom would not cover my belly button. As time went on all the shirts shrank. I don't understand how a 100% polyester shirt shrinks, but mine did.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good shirt for summer sun protection
customer_reviews.text: I have bought half a dozen or so of these shirts so far. I have a family history of melanoma so I am fanatical about skin protection. At the same time my arms are quite hairy and sun-screen just lathers up on them, plus I just don’t like sun-screen. These shirts give me the UV protection that I need. They are comfortable and not at all hot to wear - and I live in California’s Central Valley where triple-digits are the norm. They wear well, clean up well, wick the sweat away and keep me both cool and protected. Additionally, they make a great base layer for the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: My dermatologist strongly recommended that I start wearing UPF shirts(lots of skin cancers). I was given a catalog and the prices were sky high and beyond my budget but I came here to Amazon and found this shirt. It fits well, looks good and was more than 1/2 off the catalog merchandise. I will definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Rhyan

customer_reviews.title: Functional as advertised. And CONSISTENT sizing and manufacture
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these moisture wicking shirts. They are awesome. I am going to order three more for a total of six. I used to buy at REI (they had good stuff, but then changed their styling). I used to buy SA out of Boca Raton FL. But they did not have consistent sizing. But these are functional, affordable and sized/ designed the same way every time. Yes, I will order three more soonest in case they change something about their manufacture (I hope they don't). Great base layers also, because they are not too thick to wear under a button down shirt. Perfect here in Colorado where the weather can change often.
customer_reviews.author: dark timber

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a few long-sleeved shirts for sun protection during outdoor activities, mostly things like yard work etc. I have specialized gear for cycling, MTB, backpacking, but nothing more general for around the house. I checked out some of the big box sports stores but quality was questionable and they were expensive. I found these on amazon and in a word... WOW. I am very impressed with the quality, fit, durability and above all the sun protection. We live in the western USA high desert and I can work all day outside and not have any after-effects of sun exposure. I picked up two and now I'm getting a few more. Nice color choice too!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Baker

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY! THREADS COMING OUT & IT WILL FALL APART
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality, ALL threads are coming out around bottom, neck and under armpit & sleeves. I’ve worn 3x and it is falling apart. DO NOT BUY! Go to sporting goods store and spend more for the best quality. I was in a rush otherwise that is what I would have done, now I am waiting for the company’s response to return these. Quality has no price, I’d rather spend 10-20 dollars more and have my shirts for many years rather than waste money on something I can’t even donate after because it fell apart. We have enough trash in the landfills and that alone is enough for me not to buy rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: Francesco

customer_reviews.title: I find this shirt to be less comfortable and cooling than a similar shirt I bought from ...
customer_reviews.text: I find this shirt to be less comfortable and cooling than a similar shirt I bought from a fishing store a few years ago. That shirt is a bit heavier but seems to feel cooler. This one doesn't seem to breath as well and feels more like old style polyester (scratchy). I gave this a try because it was less expensive and that probably explains it - sometimes you score a bargain, sometimes you don't.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shirt from someone who has been looking for something like this for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product...ok I was scared to order because I couldn't find the right feel, material and cut. I'm 222lbs bodybuilder and avid hiker. I love my shirts a little more fit on chest yet flexible and comfortable in midsection for working out, HIT training and hiking. These are perfect. My chest is 46inches and the size Large is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Form vs Funk
customer_reviews.text: I love these shirts but would say dont get too attached to them. I bought 4 last year and they were shredded by a 3 month rotation. They stain easily and once the stink sets in oxy clean just shrugs. They have to be destroyed. However, they kept me shaded and cool when i was sweating like crazy and i didnt get a burn all summer. That's worth 85 buck imo. If the company wants to send me some free ones I'd be happy to wear them out.
customer_reviews.author: brian pusateri

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad!
customer_reviews.text: I am 6ft and 175lbs with a 42 chest and I ordered the Arctic Blue in a Large. Absolutely love the Arctic Blue color and will probably order more because of this color! Oh so soft to the touch. The fit is almost perfect, except maybe a half inch too baggy in the torso, so i would deduct a quarter star for that if i could. I do wonder how a medium would fit me. The length is perfect. I am comparing this brand to the equivalent in Hanes, Cloth Co, Denali and Opna, all of which seem to make this exact same shirt or something extremely close to it.
customer_reviews.author: NetGod

customer_reviews.title: Long in the sleeve but otherwise PERECT!
customer_reviews.text: Best deal fo the money. The fit is pretty accurate although the sleeves tend to be long. No biggie, you can always roll the sleeve up . I bought 8 for our al women's saltwater fishing team ranging in sizes XS through 4 XXXX for the guide. I never wore sunscreen and was on the water 10 hours. If you are a DIY'er and need to heat press a name or logo, they take it great! Washing is easy and fishy blood stains come out with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Lori B.

customer_reviews.title: The shirts look and fit great. I recently had a bone marrow transplant and ...
customer_reviews.text: The shirts look and fit great. I recently had a bone marrow transplant and have to be careful in the sun and purchased 8 shirts of different colors. The shirts fit perfectly, not too tight, not too lose. I'm 6 foot 200 lbs and extra large is perfect. Only one problem with one shirt where some stitching has come undone but I've not sent it back and just watching how the other shirts hold up. Still give the product 4 stars, 5 if the one shirt did fail......
customer_reviews.author: HARLEY RIDER 1176

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this shirt.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this shirt countless times working in the yard in the middle of the summer with incredibly high humidity. I was skeptical about wearing a long sleeve shirt in that type of miserable weather but it keeps you cool. Mostly importantly it keeps you from getting sunburned. I will definitely add more of these to my yard work wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Going to stick with Coolibar after this
customer_reviews.text: I've always worn Coolibar sun-protection shirts before. Based on the reviews, I thought this would be significantly less expensive alternative. And, it was less expensive, but it also wasn't anywhere near as good as a Coolibar sun-protection shirt. The fabric was heavier and it didn't fit as comfortably as a Coolibar shirt. Technically, it fit, but it was a closer fit that felt, to me, more restrictive. And, the shirt just didn't "breathe" as well. Bottom line, I saved money and got an inferior product that I left in the hotel room when I checked out.
customer_reviews.author: JFC

customer_reviews.title: Quality is excellent, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fits true to size. Quality is excellent, especially for the price. If this shirt lasts half as long as my Columbia shirts I will still be money ahead. I'm hard on my outdoor clothes. I wear them hard and get them filthy. I swim in them, work out in them, work in them- whatever. I use them for sun protection as much as anything else. This shirt material feels great and the seams look good. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Sweet shirt, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for a couple of nice uv resistant, moisture wicking shirts to wear fishing shirts but couldn't find any that didn't have some goofy fish scene printed on them. Stumbled across these on Amazon and decided to give them a shot. I'm relatively thin, at 6'2 and about 165. In long sleeve shirts I normally buy mediums and just expect that the sleeves will be a little too short for me. In these shirts I ordered a medium and the sleeve length fits me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kegley

customer_reviews.title: Not as high a quality as I first thought.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Vapor Apparel Men’s UPF 50+ UV Sun Protection Long Sleeve Performance T-Shirt for Sports and Outdoor Lifestyle.... I've had this for a few months now, worn twice, washed twice (Gentle cycle cold) Dried (Low heat, slow tumble)....Went to wear it today and noticed the inside seam was unraveling....LOTS of thread hanging down....Not happy at all.... I now have three of these shirts and I am wondering if they will even last until the end of the year.....☹
customer_reviews.author: Rigg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.  Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I use UA base layer, long sleeve shirts under my cycling jerseys for controlling temperature and sun exposure. But, the UA shirts are hard to find -- believe it or not -- and expensive. This shirt compares well to the "brand name" shirts in quality and is much less expensive. It is very comfortable and works well for my needs. The sleeves are somewhat longer than the UA shirts in comparable sizes, which is a good thing for keeping my wrists covered up. I can see now I will buy more of these -- there are several nice colors available!!!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit. Man is 6' 4" and is large ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit. Man is 6' 4" and is large in stature. The sleeve length is great as it covers him all the way to his wrists. Light weight fabric is very breathable! We live in Florida and he works outside. Color is as expected from the Amazon pictures. He is very impressed how cool this shirt makes him! I would recommend this purchase to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Order it smaller than what you think!
customer_reviews.text: Not the best shirt on the market and definately has a loose fit. I'm 6'0", 215 and normally wear an XL. I ordered this in large and was swimming in it, forgive the pun. I have long arms and the sleeves were past my hands. Don't know if this particular shirt was miss-marked or what, but it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: mkpi

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and good sun coverage
customer_reviews.text: I took this shirt out on a boat in the St. Croix River on a hot sunny day. I am very white and burn easily but also don't want to use an excessive amount of sun screen. I used sunscreen on exposed areas that had a greater SPF rating than the shirt. The shirt performed flawlessly and I did not get any burns in the areas covered by the shirt. It also fit very well and even though the temperature was high I did not have any problems with excessive heat or perspiration. This shirt is now a part of my sun survival kit.
customer_reviews.author: George Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Kept me from burning!
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews that said the spf was not that strong and the company’s response explained that white and black have the highest spf so I purchased a black top and put sunscreen on before wearing the shirt— just to be double safe. 5 hours in the sun and no sunburn while wearing the black top! I was worried I would get so hot in black— but honestly I couldn’t tell a difference. It was loose enough to have a little air flow but tight enough that I could swim fine without it flapping up. I wore this with a sports bra and running shorts for the day at the lake!
customer_reviews.author: lewgirl

customer_reviews.title: Protect Your Skin
customer_reviews.text: As my Asian skin doctor tells me "You are a European in Indian Country"... I make Casper look tan and grew up burning and peeling... I am paying for it now with visits to my dermatologist...No major cancer, but you need to protect yourself. With my area getting frequently over 100 degrees, and full sun, i needed something to wear that wouldn't overheat me. This is the answer...a lightweight, long-sleeved shirt that will protect my skin, which is important, cause it keeps all my innards in place
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good shirt, but much cheaper is available.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shirt. Fits well. I guess it keeps me cooler than a cotton t-shirt. I bought the safety green, and it stains easily. Based on reviews I bought a XL, and I’m glad I did—the 2XL wouldn’t been too big. T-shirts, I generally need a 2XL these days. Since buying this shirt I’ve found the same shirt made by Hanes where two shirts are cheaper than this one shirt. I’m gonna buy those instead.
customer_reviews.author: MadBrad

customer_reviews.title: Weird, Bad Fit, comes up high and tight in Armpits
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 different brands of UV shirts for my husband, this brand was the big loser. The fabric was the worst feeling and the fit was so off, tight in the armpits, the shirt came up too high in the pit area. He tried a large and Xl. He is 5'11 and 170 lbs. He like the Baleaf best and my son and I loved the Naviskin!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Keeps sun off skin, reflects Texas' sun, keeps one cooler in the heat.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband and he was surprised how much better he felt wearing this shirt working on tractor and projects in the heat. Much better than the hot short-sleeved t-shirts he was wearing. I was already wearing them and we reccommend them. FYI - For stains hard to get out , we use laundry soap with a dime size of Dawn Dishsoap and 1/4 cp shout. Not an employee for Dawn or Shout. Just trying to be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: MeThinkest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent swim suit coverup for plus 26/28W female (sunblock fabric 50+ UPF) Swim, but don't get 'burned'
customer_reviews.text: A little long, (comes to hips) it is a man's size 4x; perfect for a plus woman 26/28W. Covers swimsuit with a 50+ UPF sunblock, just what I needed, (I'm a redhead, skin cancer survivor, loves to swim, BUT lives in Florida--harsh sun). Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth G

customer_reviews.title: This is only about the fit
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived and I don’t know if it does what I hired it to do. This is just about the fit. I’m 5’7” and weight 145. Medium shirts are usually a little snug, so I got a medium. The shoulders are good, the arms are at least an inch too long and the torso is pretty loose, but the length is fine. If I ever get another, I’ll definitely get a small. I just thought others should know what size they need.
customer_reviews.author: Mongo

customer_reviews.title: Good, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Very light material, somewhat see-through I wore it in 105 degree weather yesterday and didn't feel too hot. Fits a little smaller than advertised. Probably not enough to go a full size up
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight cool and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I must wear these shirts as I have a reaction between medication and sunlight and I burn very badly. They are light and very comfortable. I do not perspire while wearing them in Florida in the middle of the summer. I'm very happy with this product. I am a large man and I would prefer if these were made in a 5x which would fit me Loosely and would be more comfortable. Otherwise the shirts are very good I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Thawyzard

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking Shirt
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shirt for rim to rim Grand Canyon hike and was perfect for this trip. Shirt is lightweight and has nice air flow and sun protection so I stayed cool with breeze and unfried in heat of day with severe sun exposure and little shade. The fabric is soft and comfortable, dries fast but was thick enough to prevent strafing from backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for sun protection and you can wear in 90 degree weather with high humidity
customer_reviews.text: I’m a deliver driver so I’m outside 8+ hours a day and it’s been in the 90’s these past few weeks and I was getting sun poisoning. I tired sunscreen but I would sweat it off so I had to no choice but to look for a long sleeve undershirt and these did the trick. I was worried that I would overheat but I didn’t. They kept me cool and when I would sweat the shirt would dry fast and they are very comfortable. In men’s I wear a large and in women’s I wear a x-large. This fit me kinda loose but I ended up liking that. Very happy with this long sleeve. I ordered five more
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mendez

customer_reviews.title: ... rather than the fitted women’s version because I don’t like my hiking clothing to hug the body
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the men’s version of this shirt rather than the fitted women’s version because I don’t like my hiking clothing to hug the body. I’m 5’6 and slim. I ordered the men’s small and should have sized down further, but I still wear and like the shirt. Great sun protection. I got a very light blue color and it requires a cami underneath because it’s pretty see through. I can’t complain of being hot in it though. Also it’s nice to not have to apply and reapply sunscreen to shoulders and arms when hiking. If there is a breeze at all, it flows through the fabric nicely.
customer_reviews.author: AdventureOn

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Shirt!
customer_reviews.text: 1st of all this shirt is golf and shiny. The color is not even close to the picture. 2nd it is too baggy. The shirt is super loose around the waist and arms and it looks terrible. My wife laughed out loud when I tried it on. Lastly, it does not breath well. I couldn’t imagine wearing it when it is even remotely warm. It seems super thick. I only paid $10 for the shirt because I bought it on Prime Day and I am still returning it. This is a horrible shirt!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I first returned a size L that was much too large, which led me to order a size M. It turned out to be too small though leaves reached my knuckles. Additionally, the side stitches were defective creating creases, as shown on the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Gubefaro

customer_reviews.title: Not the same size as before...
customer_reviews.text: I love these shirts! I bought 5 of them previously all in the medium size, however, this time when I purchased it (in the same size) it fit much shorter on both the arms and bottom. Not sure if this was a one off sizing issue or if this is the new size moving forward, but I already washed it so there's no returning for me. If this is the new size moving forward, I would recommend sizing up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Y

customer_reviews.title: Good shirt, but this one has a very small neck hole
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased an identical shirt to this one from Vapor Apparel in the past, and I've loved it. This is the same good material and workmanship, except, for some reason, the neck hole is about 2 inches smaller in diameter than the previous shirt of the same shirt size. It is actually tight on my neck, which is uncomfortable. The rest of the shirt construction and sizing is fine.
customer_reviews.author: JJ-Idaho

customer_reviews.title: In no way a 4xl
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6" and 325lbs so I bought the 4xl. I know I'm a big guy but I couldn't even get the shirt on. This is the smallest 4xl I've ever bought. I have no idea where they got their reference size from but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Hamlets Twin

customer_reviews.title: Great shirts! Great service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of the long sleeve shirts for my kayaking and other outdoor activities in the harsh Florida summer sun. I liked the first one so much I ordered a second one in a different color. The shirts fit great. Perfect really and do a great job of protecting me from the sun. They are stylish and comfy. I did have a minor issue and contacted the seller and they took care of it immediately. Excellent customers service.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Grand Canyon approved!
customer_reviews.text: In 2018 we did a rim to rim in the Grand canyon in one day. I wore the safety orange version of this and it protected me the whole day, never applying sunscreen. I have 12 of these shirts, four different colors three shirts each. I love them. At the gym, they keep my sweat from being flung around when I'm on the treadmill or the elliptical arc trainer. You guys know what I mean. The colors hold fast after multiple washes And I have yet to have a seam come loose.
customer_reviews.author: LRSilence

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: Last week I ordered/received a Vapor Apparel shirt (size Large) perfect in every way: "Vapor Apparel Men's UPF 50+ UV Sun Protection Outdoor Performance Long Sleeve T-Shirt Large Citrus" So I ordered a second one of different color: "Vapor Apparel Men’s UPF 50+ UV Sun Protection Long Sleeve Performance T-Shirt for Sports and Outdoor Lifestyle, Large, Arctic Blue" Although labeled "large" like the first one, it had to be a 2X or 3XL, hem approaching my knees with sleeves a foot too long. So it was mis labled and they charged me $3.42 for return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: ezstreet

customer_reviews.title: Best sunshirts ever
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 6’4” fair skinned baby boy, who fries like a lobster in the sun. These shirts are comfy and casual and easy to wear and allow him to get out there and mow my lawn without burning or overheating. I would say they stain sort of easily, but he abuses clothes. He wears them everywhere in summer, in the pool, around the house, under the car, to the range... excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: NurseDawn

customer_reviews.title: Me Again
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the package, tried it on and I'm giving it a 5 Star! It feels superior, just feels like it's going to work perfect at keeping me Cooler. I've got to do something ya'll, the sun is killing me. A Long sleeve shirt in Summer, in Alabama. This sounds KRAZY. I'm leaving the 5 Star review up but, I will change it if things don't work out as expected. I'm ordering a Sun hat too AND the highest rated "blue' vaporizing towel I could find. Here's to a COOL Summer!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Fordham

customer_reviews.title: Loose fit; comfortable fabric; well-made
customer_reviews.text: We got a number of UPF shirts on Amazon Prime Day for members of our household: adults and children. We are pleased with the Vapor shirts, especially in comparison with other brands. We prefer the loose fit rather than tight fit. The garment construction is good. These are made in Columbia; sold through USA. You're getting an "American" product, not Chinese.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Awesome Shirts
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my second long sleeve light weight shirt and it will not be the last! These shirts are great, better than the high priced "name" brands, which I also have hanging in my closet. The big plus with the Vapor shirts is that when wearing them I do not have to advertise someone's clothing brand. They fit well (sleeves are not too short), they wash well and hold up after many times thru the washer and dryer. I am a happy and very satisfied customer. No I do not work for Vapor .... I just believe in their product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: I got the biggest size available at the time. BUT..
customer_reviews.text: It FIT pretty good for a men's 3XL. Even though I usually wear a 5XL in Women's( Catherine's sizes). And the sleeves were really long on my short arms.. BUT I knew it would be tight. But it wasn't as tight as I anticipated. And it stretches a little bit once YOU get into the water.I Loved it. And when I need another long sleeve Sun 🌞 shirt I Will definitely come back and hopefully they'll have something bigger. Or I'll have lost weight one. See you then.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic shirts!!
customer_reviews.text: I've got fair skin and burn VERY easily. I'd purchased one of these shirts a few years ago to wear to some pool parties and my upper body never got the slightest amount of burn (unlike the back of my neck and nose). I'm going on an extended cruise in the Mediterranean later this summer and certainly wanted to be outdoors, but not burn. So, I bought six of these in varying colors. Does that tell you how great I think they are?
customer_reviews.author: Jack E. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: The only brand I buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand I buy for UV shirts. The price point is decent and the quality of the product is great. I have bought several colors of this shirt for the husband, he uses it for fishing. The fit is great and very comfortable. It also helps that it is plain with no brand showing or big drawings. The variety of colors are nice too.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Where is it made?
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't happy with the fact that a tag was attached to the shirt with the signatures of the employees who worked to make it in the USA, yet on the shirt itself it said Made in Colombia. Something wrong with this and it bothers me that they would go to all the trouble to print this card with signatures bragging that it was made in the USA, when apparently that's not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Drusilla Willhite

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but different than an earlier one purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a vapor long sleeve shirt in yellow and it’s one of my favorite shirts to be outside in. So I ordered another one, but’s it’s a bit different. The new one has a hard paper tag inside the collar whereas the older one had the label imprinted. Also this new one it tighter at the neck and the fabric seems just a bit rougher feeling. Still good but different, like maybe they cut some costs. Still says made in Colombia so who know.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Buy
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable material, wicks sweat fast and keeps you cool. I used them under my work coveralls to keep me cool in the summer. Works good I recommend this product ***fits as expected****
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: I LIKED THEM SO MUCH ORDERED TWO MORE
customer_reviews.text: I LIKED THEM SO MUCH ORDERED TWO MORE ...ONLY PROBLEM I FOUND WAS THE ARTIC BLUE WAS A LOT LIGHTER THAN EXPECTED. I'M 6-4" AND 300LBS XXXXL WAS JUST RIGHT i BOUGHT A UVA+UVB METER BECAUSE OF ALLERGY TO SUN ON ARMS. HAD A READING OF 8000+ IN BRIGHT SUNLIGHT SO I PUT A LAYER OF YOUR SHIRTS OVER THE SENSOR AND HAD A READING OF LESS THAN 40 BELIEVE IT OR NOT. REALLY SPECTACULAR. I TESTED THE SP 75 SUNSCREEN IN A SIMILAR FASHION AND IT HAD A READING OF OVER 300. THE SHIRTS WITH SUNSCREEN UNDERNEATH LOOKS LIKE THE WAY TO GO. SURPRISED AT HOW MOST SPILLS ON THE SHIRTS CAN EASILY BE WASHED OUT EVEN BLOOD...
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Material Breathed well
customer_reviews.text: Are use it for fishing on hot days when I don’t want my arms to be exposed to the sun for that it worked pretty well but for the size I ordered I thought it should’ve been a little looser
customer_reviews.author: Jory D Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Cool shirt, literally.
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shirts. They do keep me cooler than a regular cotten or nylon shirt. And if you're working extra hard and sweating a lot the shirt gets wet and will cool you down even more. Like using these instead of spraying chemical sunscreen all over as well. Good pool or surf shirt. Loose threads hanging off of each sewn seam so the quality could be a smidge better. Still a 5 star product though!
customer_reviews.author: pataz

customer_reviews.title: Great product BUT BE AWARE of shirts manufactured in Colombia
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface by saying I have 3 of these shirts purchased from this vendor and all were perfect except for this one. I notice the tag is different, and the stamp on the collar like the original as you can see from the pic is not the same. The shirt is cut differently and does not fit the same as original. Material also feels slightly heavier as well. Will be ordering directly on vapor wear site going forward. As far as the authentic product, I would give it 6 stars if I could. Absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: Anand P

customer_reviews.title: Women like Dark Colors Too
customer_reviews.text: Love these, already bought 7. They are great for high altitude (La Paz, Bolivia) where it is very sunny but cold. They endure a lot of traveling & many washes. My only complaint is that I have to buy mens because the women's are all pastel/ light colors. I buy the men's XS & could go smaller. I like Black, Red & Blue.
customer_reviews.author: Charrlie

customer_reviews.title: They fit very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These shirts are wonderful! Fit great. Material is very comfortable. Washing (cold water and hang up to dry) is very easy. Just use soap detergent. No bleach or fabric softener. I highly recommend this product. What else would you like me to say? The VAPOR shirts, both long and short sleeve are wonderful. See above!
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Rothman

customer_reviews.title: Bought one for Hubby and Son! Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2xl for my Hubby and Small for my 16 year old Son. Both fit great and are comfy! They wore them in the pool and found out that they make a hilarious bubble when you pull them away (think big hero 6)😂 A lot of laughs!! Anyway, these shirts protect them from the AZ sunburn and I would highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Goldiehwn1

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shirt
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I have issues with basil skin cancer and I am a ginger with fair skin. The shirts fit a little tight in the upper chest and loose around the stomach. I wear my company shirt on top of it and in the FL heat, I stay cool. I was surprised by that, it has helped my skin and lessen my arms from getting burned. I bought several of these and use them around the home too.
customer_reviews.author: Donto & Amy

customer_reviews.title: breathe with me
customer_reviews.text: bought sage, but color is unlike the picture.its more washed out. it worked well in dry moderate climate (up to 79F), but did not work well in humid conditions At 90F I felt like I was inside a sauna, and the only way to get cool was to take this shirt off, and get under an ice cold shower. fit is perfect. based on color (attracts mosquitoes just like white would), and the fact that it does not work in humid climates is a huge negative for me. it also stained easy with dust mixing with sweat around neck, and armpits. i will still wear it in the fall when humidity drops.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Poor stitching
customer_reviews.text: During second wearing the stitching started to come undone on the sleeve. It did not get hard use the first time. I held a two year old in a pool for about an hour or so then I sat on a chair - too much though for the shirt I guess.
customer_reviews.author: gregg Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear to the beach in Florida this summer after being diagnosed with skin cancer. The shirt is okay dry ( a little big but not too bad) but it is like a dress when wet. It hangs down to my knees and would wrap around my waist twice. I have the short sleeve in this brand and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shirts. I bought these for my trip to Costa Rica where I was planning on doing a lot of hiking and spending lots of time in the sun at the beach. The fabric material was very nice and felt cool even in the humidity and heat. The shirt also has the added benefit of preventing mosquitos bites.
customer_reviews.author: Rusticated

customer_reviews.title: Performs and fits as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, well-sized in the arms, shoulders, chest and waist. I have a short torso so need to have the length made about 3" shorter. Wore one hiking on a very hot day and it performed as expected. Excellent value for the money. Definitely check the sizing chart and know your measurements before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Gips

customer_reviews.title: Will be purchasing additional shirts
customer_reviews.text: Great value, 50 uv protection ( having had melanoma three times I want this protection), good fit (not a fitted shirt), really is safety orange, quick dry. Breathable and comfortable on a 1 hour bike ride on a sunny AZ 86 degree day . Can see myself wearing these shirts into the into the mid 90's. Plan on buying a couple more colors.
customer_reviews.author: Gary in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Bought for beach vacation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shirt to take on vacation so I didn’t get burned on the beach day 1 and have my trip ruined and the shirt worked great! Fit as expected, more of an athletic fit, but that worked out great because I wore it under a life jacket when we went parasailing, swimming with dolphins, kayaking, etc.. the material was great for the extremely hot weather as well. I’m about 6’2 230lbs and went with the XXL and it was a great fit. Great shirt and great price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy for "Vapor"
customer_reviews.text: With a name like "Vapor," I expected an extremely light and breathable shirt for hot weather. I ordered white to reflect sun and keep cool. The shirt would be better described as a fairly average, moderately light base layer. My lightest long sleeve "rash guard" type shirts weigh 4 ounces. This one (Large) weighs 6.75 ounces. It is a perfectly fine, moderately light, tightly knitted base layer, but not vapor light. Not what I expected, so I will return.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: It does not cling to your body but it keeps you feeling cool
customer_reviews.text: This shirt is amazing, it fits well and keeps your body cool and breathable. I wore this shirt on the hottest of days and even when am working in the sun the high lighted colors makes you visible to on coming traffic. I would recommend this shirt to my one who heading for a family sun day on the beach or person who works on the road side wether it be directing traffic or any thing else to that sort
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking shirt
customer_reviews.text: Used this shirt last summer for a hike of the John Muir Trail and it worked very well. Even though it was hot while we were on the trail the shirt provided sun relief and kept me cool. It was also thick enough to keep the mosquitoes at bay. I ended up throwing it away after using it for practice hikes and the JMT trip, but will be purchasing another for a trip to the Sawtooths in Idaho this summer. Even on my practice hikes here in Minnesota in some hot and humid conditions the shirt worked well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Cool to the. Core !!! It did its JOB !!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this shirt at a100k Ultra marathon that began at high noon with temps @ 99°f. Temps reached 110° This shirt helped me endure the first 30 miles of the race without overheating the core of my body. It definitely did what I purchased it for. Before purchasing, I browsed to see if anyone had wore it for running and I did not locate a comment. I wanted to reassure any runners that this product works !! No Chafee!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chicle Rosales

customer_reviews.title: These provide quality protection from the Sun, and are quality made
customer_reviews.text: These fit my husband well. My husband has had melanoma in the past removed off of his back, so these were a very important investment to make. They are pricey, but what are you going to do when your husband has to ride a bike to work everyday, and you have no car, and the Sun is literally beating on his body 2 hours every day each day of the week. The shirts themselves appear to be quality made, and have stood up to washings. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Falon

customer_reviews.title: Great fit! Long enough sleeves!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these shirts. One to wash./One to wear. They fit perfectly! They even have long enough sleeves!! This last is important as I am a 6'2" woman with very long arms. I wear the shirt to ride my bicycle. The SPF50 keeps the sun off & the "safety orange" color keeps me visible to traffic when I'm riding on county roads rather than on the bike trail. The shirt does tend to creep up to my waist while I'm riding, but that isn't a flaw in the shirt. The motion of riding a recumbent trike makes the shirt move. I can put elastic in the hem to stop this reaction. CMB
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, very effective sunscreen, not sweaty
customer_reviews.text: These lightweight shirts feel great to me. I've now ordered several. They're not sweaty, they protect very effectively against the sun, and they're generously sized (not clingy, which is a good thing for me). They wash and dry quickly, and don't retain body odor. Very pleased with the quality of these products.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph B

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Utility worker here. I got sick of drivers trying to hit me while working in the roadway. These shirts are very bright and makes me very noticeable. Light and great for summer time and does seem to keep my body temp down while working in the sun all day. Stains easily and holds B.O. more then a cotton shirt does. Fit sizes are accurate and the price was right. I would recommend these shirts to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Rob n Em

customer_reviews.title: Good sun protection against UV rays
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona currently, and have to spend a lot of time outdoors in the sun. I did my research and found out that this brand was one of the brand's that was certified in giving protection against UV rays. The fit of this shirt was fairly good - it fit as per the size chart. Shirt was comfortable to wear, and wearing it, I didn't feel my skin burning up. For the reduced risk of skin cancer, I can't complain too much about the price!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great sun protection~
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, nice wicking properties. Sleeves and tails were long enough. Fit a tiny bit snug at the waist, but chest and hips were as expected. Light color reflected the heat, so even during a 100* day at Walt Disney world in Florida, it kept me cool-ish and protected from the sun!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Value For Money
customer_reviews.text: I like it because (1) it's cool when it's hot out there; (2) it wicks moisture well: (3) it's comfortable due to the smooth and stretchy fabric; (4) its cutting is just right; (5) good sun protection as the fabric's thickness is just right; (6) it's well made. I wear it for jogging and hiking in hot weather (temperature @34 C with an RH of 90%+) here in Hong Kong. I think it's just as good (if not better) than my UA Heatgear t-shirts. It certainly is value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Kin C

customer_reviews.title: Great shirt. Don’t be fooled into a larger size though
customer_reviews.text: Good, high quality sun shirt. Worked wonderfully to help my husband avoid sunburn on a recent trip to Hawaii. I wish I hadn’t allowed some of the reviews to convince me to buy a larger size though. My husband is 5’10 and about 180 pounds. I ordered a large, but the medium would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna M. WingetTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... layer for warmth early in the morning and works great to stay cool in the sun on hot days
customer_reviews.text: Adds an extra layer for warmth early in the morning and works great to stay cool in the sun on hot days. Dries quickly and the material is comfortable against the skin. The reason for 3 stars is because it is tight under the arms in the armpit area where the sleeve seam meets the shoulder. I have a muscular build so maybe thats why, but it does get uncomfortable after a long day of fishing. Fit is as expected if you order based on your sweater size.
customer_reviews.author: joshoutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to sunscreen.
customer_reviews.text: This shirt is comfortable even in the Florida heat. It does a great job at wicking moisture and breathing to allow long sleeves in high humidity and heat.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Basic UV shirt—fits well enough.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband who is a fair-skinned redhead. He normally wears an XLT but we got him a 2X since there was no tall size. It’s a little snug around the middle, but it’s because he has a small belly going on—otherwise it fits great. He is 6’5” and weighs about 275. The shirt is nice and long though so you shouldn’t worry about butt crack! A plus for us tall people!
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected but.............
customer_reviews.text: I normally take an XL but after reading reviews got a L and it fit fine. I’m 5’10 200 #. So I ordered 2 more L and they were too small. Originally I got the figured one and it was good. The 2 others were solid colors L and they were too small. So who knows? Sent them back. Returns were free.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hamsher

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, well made! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from a skin disorder were I am losing the pigment in my skin. For years I have been dealing with vitiligo, which makes me very vulnerable to sunburns and skin cancer. Originally I bought just one shirt to try it out. I was very impressed, so much I now own 4 of them. They are light, very comfortable, cool and dry very quickly. I highly recommend these shirts, it gives me that little extra protection from the suns rays.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Both of them love these shirts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a rash guard for my BF for our Jamaica trip and as an undershirt for my dad when doing yard work in the brutal Arizona sun. Both of them love these shirts. No sunburns and doesn't get too hot. Purchased more.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena J. Altman

customer_reviews.title: It is NOT just like the ladies shirt as someone stated - this is ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as an alternate option of the ladies shirt I purchased. Based on other comments about size, I decided on the Large...I should have gone with the medium. It is NOT just like the ladies shirt as someone stated - this is straight, not fitted at all. It works as a loose cover up when swimming though, and served its purpose in protecting me from the sun.
customer_reviews.author: SueH57

customer_reviews.title: Nice shirt
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for fishing shirts. The color was exactly what was expected. They run a bit smaller than the size chart. I normally wear an XL & ordered that size again based on size chart. It does fit but just a little snug than I want it. Because of that I given it 4 stars. The quality of the material is great! I will order again but in the XXL & few different colors.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Comfy lightweight Shirt
customer_reviews.text: Got this for playing golf in but know think I'll wear it more than golf. Played in 101-degree heat in the desert and while you fell hot (101-degree) it actually felt very comfortable and light. Didn't feel sweaty or like I wanted to change into a short sleeve. I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: I didn't want to spend the whole day reapplying sunscreen or risking a burn so this seemed like the best option
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this ahead of a water park visit bc my husband has extreme sun sensitive due to a medicine he takes. I didn't want to spend the whole day reapplying sunscreen or risking a burn so this seemed like the best option. The shirt fit great, he was never hot in it (and we ordered black) and it dried quick. We did not use a base coat of sunscreen underneath and he did not come anywhere close to burning. Very satisfied with the cost and wearability and esp the results. Will definitely purchase additional for his use.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Just the right protection!
customer_reviews.text: A long term prescription for an antibiotic protects my husband’s health, but one reaction is that he is sensitive to the sun! This repeat purchase will meet our needs as it not only provides UV protection, but is all well-made, comfortable, and smart-looking at a reasonable price! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine H.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit tight, but that was expected, it's a swim shirt after all! My husband loves it! He wasn't sure about it at first, but I insisted he wear it during the heat of the day for swimming, and now he wears it more often than I wear mine! When it's wet it helps keep you cool in the heat, and it does a really good job protecting from the sun. Definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Skiba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shirt for the money-performs and fit well.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn both my light blue and light yellow shirts here in Phoenix this summer and they both protected me as I expected them too with no additional sunscreen worn on my skin beneath it. I'm 6'1" and have arms an inch longer than "normal" for my height and the sleeves were just long enough (could have been a tad longer for me but then for the person with average length arms, these sleeves should be great.) They both laundered well with no sweat staining at this point- especially around the collar where it contacts my sunscreened and sweaty neck. I will buy more. Why only 4 stars then?....nothings perfect. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Elac2az

customer_reviews.title: Great Active/hiking/camping shirt
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shirt and it has become my go-to hiking and other active activity shirt when you are outside or it is a little cool for a short sleeve. Not quite as comfy as cotton, but obviously drys much better. If you are going to have to wear something for awhile getting sweaty or dirty or wet, I'd choose this every time. It layers well too, and often I have worn another short sleeve shirt over it for a different look or added warmth. I would buy again and I probably will get another color at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you cool with protection from sun.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shirt for bike riding that would be cool in warm weather and give more skin protection from the sun, to include the arms. I was so pleased with this shirt I bought a second shirt for me and one for my wife. I live along the southern coast so I got to try it out in warm, humid weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Vapor Apparel Men’s UPF 50+ UV Sun Protection Long Sleeve Performance T-Shirt for Sports and Outdoor Lifestyle
feature_bullets: PERMANENT PROTECTION: The UPF 50+UV/Sun Protection technology blocks the sun’s rays and is built into the fabric, unlike other shirts. Our fabric is recommended by The Skin Cancer Foundation as an effective UV protectant.

PERFORMANCE WEAR: Lightweight 100% Microfiber Polyester jersey-like shirt with PURE-tech moisture-wicking technology, which is permanently infused with the fabric to keep you dry. The Anti-odor technology keeps you fresh and odor-free.

ACTIVE LIFESTYLE: Built for athletic activities like swimming, fishing, running, hiking, playing baseball, or simply sitting at the beach all day. This t-shirt provides optimal protection for any outdoor activity like mowing the lawn or gardening.

FIT FEATURES: The set-in-shoulder construction provides a great fit and a natural, flattering shape. It is true to size in the shoulder and slimmer fitting through the body. Refer to our size chart in product images to find your best fit.

BEST CARE: Hand or machine wash in cold water and hang dry. In order to maintain the quality of this shirt, fabric softener is not required and not recommended. Sun protection properties are enhanced after several washes and wear.
